item.title: Little.Miss add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Little.Miss add a quote by Stephenie Meyer
item.description: "He's like a drug for you, Bella." -- Stephenie Meyer

item.title: Little.Miss add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "My bounty is as boundless as the sea, My love as deep; the more I give to thee, The more I have, for both are infinite." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Little.Miss add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Darkness cannot drive out darkness: only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate: only love can do that." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Little.Miss add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Don't part with your illusions. When they are gone you may still exist, but you have ceased to live." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Little.Miss add a quote by Albert Schweitzer
item.description: "Sometimes our light goes out, but is blown again into instant flame by an encounter with another human being." -- Albert Schweitzer

item.title: Little.Miss add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Classic' - a book which people praise and don't read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Little.Miss add a quote by E.M. Forster
item.description: "I suggest that the only books that influence us are those for which we are ready, and which have gone a little further down our particular path than we have yet gone ourselves." -- E.M. Forster

item.title: Little.Miss add a quote by Montaigne
item.description: "When I am attacked by gloomy thoughts, nothing helps me so much as running to my books. They quickly absorb me and banish the clouds from my mind." -- Montaigne

item.title: Little.Miss add a quote by Anna Quindlen
item.description: "Books are the plane, and the train, and the road. They are the destination, and the journey. They are home." -- Anna Quindlen

item.title: Little.Miss add a quote by Francesca Lia Block
item.description: "You are in my blood. I cant help it. We can't be anywhere except together" -- Francesca Lia Block

item.title: Little.Miss add a quote by Anne Frank
item.description: "How wonderful it is that nobody need wait a single moment before starting to improve the world." -- Anne Frank

item.title: Little.Miss add a quote by Mitch Albom
item.description: "Death ends a life, not a relationship." -- Mitch Albom

item.title: Little.Miss add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "People aren't either wicked or noble. They're like chef's salads, with good things and bad things chopped and mixed together in a vinaigrette of confusion and conflict." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Little.Miss add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "I don't know the question, but sex is definitely the answer." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Little.Miss add a quote by Henry Ward Beecherr
item.description: "Where is human nature so weak as in the bookstore?" -- Henry Ward Beecherr

item.title: Little.Miss add a quote by Henry Ward Beecher
item.description: "Books are not made for furniture, but there is nothing else that so beautifully furnishes a house." -- Henry Ward Beecher

item.title: Little.Miss add a quote by Anne Rice
item.description: "None of us really changes over time. We only become more fully what we are." -- Anne Rice

item.title: Little.Miss add a quote by Francesca Lia Block
item.description: "A kiss about apple pie a la mode with the vanilla creaminess melting in the pie heat. A kiss about chocolate, when you haven't eaten chocolate in a year. A kiss about palm trees speeding by, trailing pink clouds when you drive down the Strip sizzling with champagne. A kiss about spotlights fanning the sky and the swollen sea spilling like tears all over your legs." -- Francesca Lia Block

item.title: Little.Miss add a quote by Francesca Lia Block
item.description: "What sexual preference do you hope she has?” “Happiness.” Isnt that cool?" -- Francesca Lia Block

item.title: Little.Miss add a quote by Francesca Lia Block
item.description: "This was not a fearie tale. This was not the movies. This was life. It hurt more. It was excruciating. It was excruciatingly beautiful." -- Francesca Lia Block

item.title: Little.Miss add a quote by Francesca Lia Block
item.description: "Here you go on this long long dream. Don't even try to wake up. Just let it go on until it is over. You will learn many things. Just relax and observe because there is pain and that's it mostly and you aren't going to be able to escape no matter what. Eventually it will all be over anyway. Good luck." -- Francesca Lia Block

item.title: Little.Miss add a quote by Francesca Lia Block
item.description: "Weetzie wished she could shake blue glitter around all of them - keeping them sparkling and safe." -- Francesca Lia Block

item.title: Little.Miss add a quote by Francesca Lia Block
item.description: "The most Beautiful people are the ones that don't look like one race or even one sex" -- Francesca Lia Block

item.title: Little.Miss add a quote by Francesca Lia Block
item.description: "I will be thin and pure like a glass cup. Empty. Pure as light. Music. I move my hands over my body - my shoulders, my collarbone, my rib cage, my hip bones like part of an animal skull, my small thighs. In the mirror my face is pale and my eyes look bruised. My hair is pale and thin and the light comes through. I could be a lot younger than seventeen. I could be a child still, untouched." -- Francesca Lia Block

item.title: Little.Miss add a quote by Francesca Lia Block
item.description: "Every girl is a goddess." -- Francesca Lia Block

item.title: Little.Miss add a quote by Francesca Lia Block
item.description: "Witch Baby wanted to ask Ping how to find her Jah-Love angel. She knew Raphael was not him, even though Raphael had the right eyes and smile and name. She knew how he looked--the angel in her dream--but she didn't know how to find him. Should she roller-skate through the streets in the evenings when the streetlights flicker on? Should she stow away to Jamaica on a cruise ship and search for him in the rain forests and along the beaches? Would he come to her? Was he waiting, dreaming of her in the same way she waited and dreamed?" -- Francesca Lia Block

item.title: Little.Miss add a quote by Francesca Lia Block
item.description: "You must reach inside yourselves where I live like a story, not old, not young laughing at my own sorrow, weeping pearls at weddings, wielding a torch to melt sand into something clear and bright." -- Francesca Lia Block
